browserProfiles.extensionSyncText:
Warning. Before you do this, please read what this functionality is for and how it works:
– This functionality is only needed for those who work with browser profiles on different physical devices and have problems with losing data in browser extensions.
– After activation, all data in the extensions will be erased and will need to be re-entered. Make sure you have saved all the necessary data from the extensions before doing this.
– After activating this feature, your browser profiles will start to synchronize data between physical devices, problems with authorization in extensions metamask, scenum, etc. will disappear.

Why it’s not possible otherwise:
Currently, chrome generates extension IDs by hashing the path to the folder with that extension.
To synchronize the settings on any operating system and on different PCs, we had to change the function responsible for generating the ID and make the result be the same on any OS. That’s why settings of extensions which use standard names will be lost. Before transferring to the new names, we advise you to make a backup of settings.

dialogs.copyErrorText: Copy error text and provide it to our support team please

help.changeIpUrlBody:
The link to change IP is used for mobile proxies.

If you do not know where to get it or how to use it, then most likely your proxies are not mobile or are supplied without this link.

By specifying this link, you have the opportunity to use two Anty options:

  • Automatically change the proxy IP address before the next profile launch
  • Set a ban on the simultaneous launch of several profiles with this proxy in order to prevent work from under one IP address in several profiles
help.proxyBody:
Valid proxy formats:

  • host:port
  • host:port:login:password
  • login:password@host:port

In addition, to the left of any of the formats, you can specify the type of proxy:

  • http://192.168.0.1:8000
  • socks5://login:password@192.168.0.1:8000
  • socks4://192.168.0.1:8000:login:password
help.proxyNameBody:
By specifying a name for a proxy, you save it to your proxy library.

Later you will be able to specify the saved proxy for new profiles, as well as bind it to existing profiles.

dialogs.logoutConfirmation: Do you really want to log out?

warning.differentPlatform:
Anty will do what you ask.

But we must warn you that emulating an operating system other than yours is not 100% possible.

Despite all the advertising claims that you may see from our respected competitors, there are a number of overwhelming technical aspects by which a foreign OS can be determined.

Therefore, we consider it honest and correct to inform you about this. We recommend creating profiles with a platform that does not differ from yours.
warning.doNotShowWarning: Don't show me this warning again

errors.uploadDenied: Sync denied. Someone started profile after you.

homepages.pagesLimitWarning: Homepages limit exceeded. You can have only 10 homepages.

proxy.checkYourself: Check yourself before you add it
proxy.formats:
Allowed formats:

  • 192.168.0.1:8000
  • http://192.168.0.1:8000:myproxy[https://change-my-proxy.com]
  • socks5://login:password@192.168.0.1:8000
  • 192.168.0.1:8000:login:password

*Additionally you can add :name at the end for any of formats
**Empty type at the beginning will cause HTTP type
***At the end, for each proxy, you can specify a link to change IP in square brackets
